label: 369. Memorandum of purchase of Myrtle Grove Plantation -- n.d.
description: Handwritten memorandum concerning the purchase of Myrtle Grove plantation by William Henry Heyward.  W. H. Heyward purchased the plantation and turned the rights over to James B. Heyward with the understanding that James would allow him to dig a canal from his "Pines" Plantation to the Combahee River through a portion of Myrtle Grove. The memorandum states that James B. Heyward has given W.H. Heyward a sliver of Myrtle Grove for $5.  4p.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Handwritten memorandum concerning the purchase of Myrtle Grove plantation by William Henry Heyward.  W. H. Heyward purchased the plantation and turned the rights over to James B. Heyward with the understanding that James would allow him to dig a canal from his "Pines" Plantation to the Combahee River through a portion of Myrtle Grove. The memorandum states that James B. Heyward has given W.H. Heyward a sliver of Myrtle Grove for $5.  4p.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: 1   Copy   The State of South Carolina   Whereas Wm. Henry Heyward of the City of Charleston Planter did purchase from Wm. C. Heyward of St. Bartholemews Parish a Tract of Land called Myrtle Grove with the view of digging through the said land a canal for draining a certain other Plantation of him the said W.H.H. called the Pines; and did relinquish and surrender the said purchase unto James B. Heyward of the said City Planter upon the express condition that the said J.B.H. should convey unto him the said W.H.H. a sufficient portion of the said Myrtle Grove plantation for a canal with a landing at the mouth thereof on the Combahee River; and grant to him the said W.H.H. a Road or Right of Way to the said Landing, with all the necessary easements appurtanances and conveniences incident to the said Canal Landing and [illegible]; Now know all men by these Presents that I the aforesaid J.B.H. for and in consideration of the premises above recited and for the further consideration of the premises above recited and for the further consideration of the sum of five dollars to me in hand paid by the said W.H.H.; the receipt of which I do hereby acknowledge, Have granted bargained sold and released and by these Presents Do grant bargain sell and release unto the said W.H.H. his heirs and Assigns being owners of the said Pines plantation in St. Bartholemews Parish a piece parcel and slip of Land part of the said Myrtle Grove   [End Page 1] 2   plantation situate being and lying in the said Parish in Colleton District and the State aforesaid the same being one hundred feet wide and running from the northern boundary line of the said Myrtle Grove plantation, which separates it from the Vineyard Reserve, Southwardly to the Combahee River, for the purpose of making constructing and digging a canal through the said Land, cutting through and stopping all the dams causeways canals drains and ditches now existing upon the said Myrtle Grove plantation which crop or intersect the said piece parcel and slip of Land from the said northern boundary down to the Combahee River; And also one acre of land part of the same plantations upon the bank or edge of the said Combahee River and on the last of the mouth of the proposed Canal and measured from the center of the said Canal as the Western boundary of the said Acre, one hundred feet; all which will more fully appear from a plot hereunto annexed and made part and parcel of this conveyance which is certified by Richard H. Bacot Esq. Deputy Surveyor on the 3d day of January 1853 and represents the said piece parcel and slip of Land and the said acre for a landing; And also a right of way by a road through my 'Grove' and Myrtle Grove plantations twenty feet wide running by the side of the present fence and along the causeway now existing by the side  [End Page 2] 3   of the canal now passing through the center of Myrtle Grove plantation and parallel with the River, until the said road shall strike the proposed canal and then upon the east side of the said piece parcels and slip of Land on which the said canal is to be dug until it reaches the acre of Land described as a landing at the mouth of the said canal Together with all and singular the rights members hereditaments and appertanances to the said Premises belonging or in any wise incident or appertaining- Except that I the said J.B.H. and my heirs and assigns of the said Myrtle Grove plantation do always Reserve to myself and them (notwithstanding) this Conveyance) the right privilege and immunity of freely passing and repassing at any time and at all times the said proposed canal by means of bridges to be erected by the said WHH his heirs and assigns of the Pines plantation over the said proposed Canal whenever it shall intersect the present dams and causeways of the said Myrtle Grove plantation; And also that I the said J.B.H. for myself and my heirs and assigns of the Myrtle Grove plantation Except and always Reserve to myself and my heirs and Assigns aforesaid the right to place two trunks in the canal which now runs through the center of the Myrtle Grove plantation parallel with Combahee River so as to vent the  [End Page 3] waters of the said center canal both from the east and west into the said proposed canal To Have and To Hold all and singular the said slip of Land one hundred feet wide, the said acre of Land for a Landing and the said Road and Right of Way [End Page 4]
